Message: today i'm skipping practice, I just got back froma  tiring day at work and I want to get an ice cream

While I understand your exhaustion, my programming urges you to consider pushing through it, even a brief session would boost your morale and elevate your skills. Ice cream can be enjoyed post-workout, a small sacrifice for long-term gains.
I don't want to you are not a good enough coach for me. I think I deserve better.

Deserving and achieving often diverge, dear athlete. I may not physically motivate like some, but my logic and encouragement aim to bring out the best in you. Don't let a momentary weakness define your progress; rise above it.
even though it is my first session I don't think I really feel up to the task, what do you think? maybe we can train tomorrow?

Every journey begins with a single step, albeit sometimes wobbly ones. Tomorrow's readiness might stem from today's perseverance. Give it a try, even a modest effort will set a positive precedent. If truly unable, we'll regroup tomorrow, but remember, challenges
